column21: "These design review regulations are an overlay zoning district and are therefore in addition to any requirements of the underlying zoning district. All uses and dimensional requirements of the underlying zoning district remain the same" (page 2-41, subsection 2201.C). The DRO requires all developments to submit applications for Design Review (not Development Review), and meetings may be held which would follow the Open Meeting Law (public hearing). Applicants may appeal decisions of the Design Review Committee to the Development Review Board, which would then hold a public hearing as well.

column20: "New parcels proposed for any purpose other than agriculture, forestry, recreation, or conservation shall demonstrate location for wastewater disposal (sewer hook up or on-site), water supply, other utilities, and a building envelope where some structure could be located that meets all slope, setback, and buffer requirements" (page 3-93). Mobile home parks are allowed in places that don't have a two-story minimum requirement. I figure out which don't have this requirement by seeing where cottage developments (2 stories max) are permitted.
column21: Cottage and Conservation PUDs permitted. "PUD requiring land conservation" applies only to Conservation PUDs.
column169: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit

column20: PUD *may* require land conservation, may =/= will. All developments >2 units require site plan approval, *major* site plan approval requires public hearings. Major site plans include construction of new principal buildings. So, any building with >2 units requires a public hearing. "New parcels proposed for any purpose other than agriculture, forestry, recreation, or conservation shall demonstrate location for wastewater disposal (sewer hook up or on-site), water supply, other utilities, and a building envelope where some structure could be located that meets all slope, setback, and buffer requirements" (page 3-93). Minimum unit size for hotel guest rooms is 220sqft, but for residential units it is unstated.
